content: On September 2, 1993, the Atlanta Braves made a significant move in their pursuit of the National League pennant by defeating the New York Mets 9-6 at Shea Stadium. This game featured a standout performance from Fred McGriff, who hit a pivotal three-run home run in the eighth inning, helping the Braves maintain their lead in the standings. The victory contributed to the Braves' eventual division title and set the stage for their postseason success that year, culminating in a trip to the World Series.
